page.title: 11Countryside walk
page.content: On Tuesday we went for a walk around our Domesday patch. As we went we came to more and more stinging nettles and brambles. We got stung and scratched and our feet started to ache; it also got very hot. We saw a lot of different birds: yellowhammers, housemartins, swallows, partridges and pheasants. We also found out what was growing in the fields, like sugar-beet, wheat, maize, barley, peas and oil-seed rape. When we had got to the old airfield Chris dropped all his empty shotgun cartridges he had been collecting. We ended up at the Crawleys' farm and they let us have a swim in their swimming pool. Then we had a ride back to school in Mr. Bailey's Volkswagen camper. Most of us went home and had a long sleep.
